\section{Slate Editor Demo}
\href{https://www.slatejs.org/}{Slate} is a completely customizable framework for building rich text
editors. Unlike other editors, Slate lets you build complex, nested documents with custom elements.\par
\subsection{Why Slate?}
Slate was created because existing solutions had limitations:\par
\begin{itemize}
  \item \textbf{Customizable} - The core is plugin-based, making it easy to customize

  \item \textit{Schema-less} - Define your own document structure

  \item \underline{Nested blocks} - Support for complex nested content

  \item Parallel to the \texttt{DOM} - Built on React and Immer
\end{itemize}
\subsection{Rich Text Features}
With Slate you can create editors with all the formatting options you need:\par
\begin{enumerate}
  \item \textbf{Bold}, \textit{italic}, and \underline{underlined} text

  \item \sout{Strikethrough} and \texttt{code} formatting

  \item Superscript\textsuperscript{super} and subscript\textsubscript{sub}
\end{enumerate}
\begin{quote}
  "Slate is designed from the ground up to be intuitive to use, and intuitive to understand."\par
\end{quote}
\subsection{Getting Started}
\begin{verbatim}npm install slate slate-react\end{verbatim}Read the
\href{https://docs.slatejs.org/}{documentation} to learn more.\par \par
